intro: Dichaeopsis graminoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf dichaeopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
